cab.content: From Secretary of State to Viceroy, Foreign Department,24th April 1917.(Repeated to Sir P. Cox, Basra.)p 2510] Foreiga Secret. Wingate suggests privately that Sir Murdock Macdonald, Adviser to Public Works Ministry, Cairo, who has great irrigation experience in Egypt and Soudan, might usefully be consulted about Mesopotamia!! irrigation. Macdonald proceeding shortly to London. Meanwhile, Lieutenant Colonel G arrow, Royal Engineers, now on way to Mesopotamia under orders of War Office, has been instructed by latter to break journey in Egypt and consult Macdonald on irrigation. Cox will no doubt see Garrow on arrival, and submit views in due course.t
